Dear Elmer:
I am very lauch impressed by the letter dated May 15 from Henry
M^et to you. I am impressed not only by the contest, but by

Hank for the time and effort he has devoted. If all members
of our MSB Committees had our interests at heart to this extent
I am sure that we would continue to prosper and grow even more
rapidly.
Unfortunately, I have not yet had the time to digest all of the
contents of Bank’s letter, and am therefore not in a position
to react to the various points he raises, or to your reactions
to them. I am just ready to leave for a brief trip out of town,
but I hope to get to this matter in more detail as soon as I
ret’.rrn, and you will be hearing from me shortly thereafter.
